snippet: The program, introduced in September 2012, has never been used. Despite that, it is credited with helping the European Central Bank rescue the euro.
abstract: Court of Justice, Europe's highest appeals court, grants European Central Bank legal authority to pursue its bond-buying program, known as Outright Monetary Transactions; program has not so far been used, but very idea that bank had power to pursue quantitative easing is credited with helping salvage euro in years since 2012.

byline.original: By DAVID JOLLY and JAMES KANTER
byline.contributor: David Jolly reported from Paris and James Kanter from Brussels. Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: The program, introduced in September 2012, has never been used. Despite that, it is credited with helping the European Central Bank rescue the euro.

headline.main: Europe’s Highest Appeals Court Backs Bond-Buying Program
headline.print_headline: Europe’s Top Appeals Court Allows Bond-Buying Plan
